subclusters.subcluster_name: Glutathione Deficiency and Antioxidant Imbalance Theory
Protein Oxidation and Proteolytic System Inhibition Theory
Oxidative Damage-Induced Meiotic Cohesion Loss Theory
Brain-Specific Free Radical Theory of Aging

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative damage from mitochondrial ROS and antioxidant defense influencing lifespan.
Emphasizes mitochondrial free radical formation and coenzyme Q antioxidant role in aging.
Highlights oxidative damage accumulation from ROS and antioxidant enzyme roles, linked to longevity.
Describes imbalance in antioxidant enzymes managing mitochondrial ROS leading to oxidative damage.
Focuses on mitochondrial ROS causing oxidative DNA/RNA damage and aging, modulated by calorie restriction.
Details mitochondrial ROS leakage, lipid peroxidation, and caloric restriction effects on aging.
Links mitochondrial ROS and oxidative stress to brain aging and neurodegeneration.
Describes mitochondrial oxidative damage driving cellular aging and dysfunction in mammary gland.
Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production and antioxidant defense changes in aging liver.
Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS as main source of oxidative damage accelerating aging.
Describes mitochondrial origin of free radicals and oxidative damage accumulation causing aging.
Focuses on oxidative DNA damage from mitochondrial ROS and decline in mitochondrial DNA repair.
Highlights melatonin as a key endogenous antioxidant modulating free radical damage in aging.
Describes melatonin’s direct scavenging of ROS and activation of antioxidant enzymes protecting cells.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Glutathione Deficiency and Antioxidant Imbalance Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on glutathione deficiency due to precursor shortage causing oxidative stress in aging.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes oxidative stress imbalance and hormesis effects on aging and antioxidant defenses.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Glutathione Deficiency and Antioxidant Imbalance Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links accumulation of ROS/RNS and antioxidant defense decline to oxidative stress and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Glutathione Deficiency and Antioxidant Imbalance Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on elevated ROS/RNS causing oxidative damage and cognitive decline, modulated by antioxidants.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Glutathione Deficiency and Antioxidant Imbalance Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes ROS dual role in signaling and damage with imbalance leading to aging.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative protein modifications, impaired proteolysis, and accumulation of damaged proteins.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Proteolytic System Inhibition Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes free radical-mediated protein modifications inhibiting proteolytic systems and lipofuscin accumulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Protein Oxidation and Proteolytic System Inhibition Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes protein oxidation, aggregate formation, and decline in proteasome activity in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Damage-Induced Meiotic Cohesion Loss Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative damage causing meiotic cohesion loss and chromosome segregation errors in aging oocytes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Oxidative Damage-Induced Meiotic Cohesion Loss Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links oxidative damage accumulation to physiological decline including circadian disruption, related to aging.

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on free radical-induced oxidative damage driving brain aging and neurodegeneration.
